N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 17.3 - Issuance of order

State Regulations
(a) If the
commissioner or his designee is satisfied of the need for the transfer, he
shall issue an order to the sending facility. (b) Such order shall require the facility to
transfer the patient along with the original of the admission paper and the
case record. (c) Notice of transfer
must be sent by the sending facility to the nearest relative and the Mental

Health Information Service. If the patient is under 21 years of age and the
transfer is to be made without the written consents of both the patient and
parent or legal guardian, such notice shall be provided to the Mental Health

Information Service at least three days prior to the transfer. (d) The terms of the order shall be carried
out as soon as possible. (e) The
duplicate of the order must be filed in the sending facility. (f) The director of the receiving facility
shall, within three days after the patient is received, notify the department
of the fact and the date thereof but a copy of the admission paper need not
accompany the notice. (g) When
patients are transferred from one facility in the department to another, the
sending facility shall see that the patient has suitable clothing appropriate
to the sex, age and condition of the patient and the season of the
year. (h) With the participation of
the patient, the facility shall determine who may accompany a woman patient who
is being transported to or from a facility. In permitting a woman or the
patient's father, husband, brother or son to accompany her, the team must
ascertain that there are no contraindications to granting such
permission. (i) The transfer may be
effected by the patient's family or friends, the receiving facility or other
interested party. In the event that such arrangement cannot be made the sending
facility shall effect the transfer through its own resources. Notes
